Package common

Interface IRemoteConnection

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClientRemoteConnection, RemoteConnection, ServerRemoteConnection
    public interface IRemoteConnection
extends java.rmi.Remote
    Defines the RMI Remote Server Object that allows connections at the ChatApp level (outside of individual rooms).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static java.lang.String BOUND_NAME
      The name the IStaffImplRemoteConnection object will be bound to in the RMI Registry

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void connect​(IRemoteConnection remoteConnectionStub)
      Used to connect to another chat app.
      java.util.List<IGroup> getGroups()
      Gets a list of IGroup ID's that the Remote ChatApp is actively in.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Get the name of this user.
      void quit​(IRemoteConnection remoteConnectionStub)
      Tells the remote system that holds this IStaffImplRemoteConnection object that the given IStaffImplRemoteConnection stub is no longer valid and should be removed from their system.
      void receiveInvite​(IGroup group)
      This is used to send an already connected peer an invite to their group.

    • Field Detail

      • BOUND_NAME

        static final java.lang.String BOUND_NAME
        The name the IStaffImplRemoteConnection object will be bound to in the RMI Registry
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        void connect​(IRemoteConnection remoteConnectionStub)
      throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Used to connect to another chat app. When you call this method on a foreign IStaffImplRemoteConnection stub you give the foreign chatapp associated with this stub your IStaffImplRemoteConnection stub (so that they know how to communicate with you).
        Parameters:
        remoteConnectionStub - - stub of IStaffImplRemoteConnection from the connector
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if an error occurs with remote connections.

      • getGroups

        java.util.List<IGroup> getGroups()
                          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Gets a list of IGroup ID's that the Remote ChatApp is actively in. It's okay to store these IGroups after receiving them (in a drop list or otherwise). Notice that these IGroups may become stale (their memberlists are not updated to reflect changes that occur after they are received). Make sure to utilize member synchronization protocols provided using IUpdateMemberListData.
        Returns:
        A list of serialized IGroups.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if an error occurs with remote connections.

      • receiveInvite

        void receiveInvite​(IGroup group)
            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This is used to send an already connected peer an invite to their group. The inviter provides a group to the invitee
        Parameters:
        group - A serialized IGroup to join.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if an error occurs with remote connections.

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Get the name of this user.
        Returns:
        The name of this user, as defined locally.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if an error occurs with remote connections.

      • quit

        void quit​(IRemoteConnection remoteConnectionStub)
   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Tells the remote system that holds this IStaffImplRemoteConnection object that the given IStaffImplRemoteConnection stub is no longer valid and should be removed from their system. The application quitting process must entail telling all known IStaffImplRemoteConnection stubs that one is quitting. You must leave all groups (send a message with ILeaveData) before using this method.
        Parameters:
        remoteConnectionStub - stub to be removed
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if an error occurs with remote connections.
